TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWildcardType implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A pattern type, such as the upper bounded wildcard ? extends Closeable or the lower bounded wildcard ? super String.

remarks.para: A pattern type, such as the upper bounded wildcard ? extends Closeable or the lower bounded wildcard ? super String.

Although this interface permits an arbitrary number of upper and lower bounds, all wildcard types of Java language programs are in one of two forms:
No lower bound and one upper bound. Such types are written like ? extends java.lang.Number. When the upper bound is java.lang.Object, the extends java.lang.Object suffix is optional: Set<?> is shorthand for Set<? extends java.lang.Object>.
One lower bound and an upper bound of java.lang.Object. Such types are written like ? super java.lang.String.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType[] GetLowerBounds() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the array of types that represent the lower bounds of this type.

remarks.para: Returns the array of types that represent the lower bounds of this type. The default lower bound is null, in which case an empty array is returned. Since only one lower bound is allowed, the returned array's length will never exceed one.

Docs.exception: if any of the bounds points to a missing type
if any of the bounds points to a type that cannot be instantiated for some reason

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType[] GetUpperBounds() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the array of types that represent the upper bounds of this type.

remarks.para: Returns the array of types that represent the upper bounds of this type. The default upper bound is Object.

Docs.exception: if any of the bounds points to a missing type
if any bound points to a type that cannot be instantiated for some reason
